list_definition.definition: able to think, reason and judge etc
sensible; reasonable; logical; not (over-) influenced by emotions etc

list_ex_of_definition.ex_of_definition: There must be a rational explanation for those strange noises

list_ex_of_english: More precisely, suppose that p/q is a rational number, and we search for a continued fraction representation for it.
I can be perfectly rational in believing that my faculty of vision is keener than my companions.
Preferences are rational when they are, in a precise sense, consistent.
For example, it does not demand that the content of the law be reasonable or rational.
If a player's type can be made common knowledge, rational egoists would not survive.
Then although it is highly unlikely that your ticket is the winner, this cannot make it rational to accept that your ticket won't win.
Designers are rational agents trained to follow rational methods.
I do not think that rational choice theory is always, or even usually, restricted to resiliency accounts.
